meanings.definition: To prevent or stop a hijacking.
meanings.sent1: The security team worked quickly to antihijack the plane from the hijackers.
meanings.sent2: It is important to antihijack any attempts to take control of the vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used their special powers to antihijack the villain's evil plan.
meanings.sent4: She tried to antihijack the situation by calmly talking to the agitated passenger.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software acted as a shield to antihijack any malicious attempts on the computer.

meanings.definition: A device or system designed to prevent hijacking.
meanings.sent1: The new antihijack technology installed in the car was very effective.
meanings.sent2: Passengers felt safer knowing the airplane had the latest antihijack system.
meanings.sent3: The antihijack device beeped loudly when someone tried to tamper with it.
meanings.sent4: The antihijack mechanism locked the doors automatically in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent5: The antihijack feature was a crucial addition to the security measures of the building.
